Warga Sempat Rebutan Air Bekas Cuci Gamelan Keraton Cirebon
07 Nov 2019, 15:25 by Sudirman Wamad


Warga berebut air bekas cucian gamelan (Sudirman Wamad/detikcom)

Cirebon - Tak sedikit warga Cirebon yang menyaksikan pencucian gong sekaten di Keraton Kanoman Cirebon. Aksi saling dorong demi air bekas ritual pun tak terhindarkan.Awalnya, prosesi ritual pencucian gong sekaten itu dilakukan di langgar Keraton Kanoman Cirebon. Usai dicuci dan digosok menggunakan serabut kepala dan abu batu bata merah, gamelan pusaka dibawa ke Bangsal Sekaten Keraton Kanoman Cirebon.Namun, saat gamelan baru saja hendak dibawa dan keluar dari langgar keraton. Warga yang saat itu menyaksikan langsung menyebur kolam dan sejumlah ember yang digunakan untuk mencuci gamelan. Mereka sudah membawa botol kemasan, jerigen dan lainnya. Aksi saling dorong pun terjadi.


Warga yang antusias berebut air cucian jimat (Sudirman Wamad/detikcom)

Warga mempercayai air bekas pencucian gamelan pusaka itu memiliki berkah. Sehingga mereka rela saling dorong demi mendapatkan air tersebut.Reina, salah seorang warga Desa Pegagan Lor, Kecamatan Kapetakan, Kabupaten Cirebon mengaku rutin mengikuti ritual pencucian gamelan sekaten. Reina rela menunggu berjam-jam demi mendapatkan air bekas pencucian gamelan."Dari pagi. (Airnya) buat mandi, buat anak-anak saya, supaya sehat dan waras," katanya.


Airnya dipercaya berkhasiat (Sudirman Wamad/detikcom)

Ia mengatakan air bekas pencucian gamelan pusaka itu memiliki berkah sendiri. "Sudah sering. Itu kan bekas cucian jimat, airnya bisa buat mandi," katanya.Terpisah, Juru bicara Keraton Kanoman Cirebon Ratu Raja Arimbi Nurtina mengatakan masyarakat meyakini air tersebut membawa berkah. Sebab, air yang digunakan untuk pencucian gamelan pusaka itu terlebih dahulu dibacakan selawatan dan doa."Ya melalui media air. Karena air itu dipuji-pujikan dulu. Mereka berharap mendapat berkah, biasanya digunakan untuk pertanian, kesehatan dan lainnya," kata Arimbi.Simak Video "Tradisi Berebut Receh, Cirebon"[Gambas:Video 20detik](rdy/rdy)

Residents Got Seizure of Used Water Washing Gamelan Cirebon Palace
Nov 7 2019, 15:25 by Sudirman Wamad


Residents fight over used gamelan washing water (Sudirman Wamad / detikcom)

Cirebon - Not a few citizens of Cirebon who witnessed the washing of sekaten gongs in the Cirebon Kanoman Palace. The action of pushing each other for the sake of the ritual water was unavoidable. Initially, the ritual procession of washing the sekaten gong was carried out at the Keraton Kanoman Cirebon. After being washed and rubbed using the head fibers and red brick ash, the gamelan heirlooms were taken to the Sekaten Ward of the Kanoman Palace in Cirebon. However, when the gamelan was just about to be brought out of the palace violation. Residents who at that time witnessed directly splash pool and a number of buckets used to wash gamelan. They have brought bottles, jerry cans and others. The action of pushing each other ensued.


Enthusiastic residents fighting over amulet washing water (Sudirman Wamad / detikcom)

Residents believe that the water used for washing the gamelan heirloom has blessings. So they are willing to push each other to get the water. Reina, a resident of Pegagan Lor Village, Kapetak District, Cirebon Regency claimed to routinely attend the washing ritual of sekaten gamelan. Reina was willing to wait for hours to get water used for washing gamelan. "From morning. (The water) is for bathing, for my children, to be healthy and sane," he said.


The water is believed to be efficacious (Sudirman Wamad / detikcom)

He said the water used for washing the gamelan heirloom had its own blessings. "It's often. That's used as a fetish wash, the water can be used for bathing," he said. Separately, Kanoman Cirebon Palace spokesperson Ratu Raja Arimbi Nurtina said the community believed the water was a blessing. Because, the water used for washing the gamelan heirlooms was first read the treatment and prayer. "Yes through the media of water. Because the water was praised first. They hope to get blessings, usually used for agriculture, health and others," said Arimbi. Video "Tradition of Scrambling to Receive, Cirebon" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (rdy / rdy)
